
Dr. Byte signed the secret contract with her low-exponent RSA key, but the signature 0x16deb7ed2d265f3e9e00ae836ef8e97cae2d28473442fc5059e3a4938fbeb9a0989084d2ac6817f5b5d1a38c8c232756167e1567e654041a6803bf671d740af0 may hide a shortcut to forgery. Can you exploit her careless choice?


Public Key (n, e): (7395401202505871528856408658282541457753522877451530318938256044135898771395722096351501843604852179263494315979587433717430208012759154079642253412177207, 3)

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{94hklpzn}
ciphertext: 0x16deb7ed2d265f3e9e00ae836ef8e97cae2d28473442fc5059e3a4938fbeb9a0989084d2ac6817f5b5d1a38c8c232756167e1567e654041a6803bf671d740af0
cipher: RSA Low-Exponent Signature
hint: What happens when you cube small numbers? Remember e=3!
necessary_info: Public Key (n, e): (7395401202505871528856408658282541457753522877451530318938256044135898771395722096351501843604852179263494315979587433717430208012759154079642253412177207, 3)

archetype: signature_schemes
